share.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to have or use something with other people
share.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: We don’t have enough books, so you’ll have to share.
The three of us shared a taxi.
I have an office that I share with some other teachers.
share.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to let someone have or use something that belongs to you
share.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: As a kid, he’d never share his toys.
Will you share your fries with me?
share.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to divide something between two or more people
share.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: They shared the cake between them.
On his death, his property was shared out between his children.
share.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to have equal responsibility for doing something, paying for something etc
share.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: We share the responsibility for the children.
I own the house, but we share the bills.
We all share some of the blame for the accident.
share.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to have the same opinion, quality, or experience as someone else
share.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: I believe my view is widely shared.
Other parents share her belief in the importance of reading.
Stubbornness was a characteristic he shared with his mother.
share.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: to tell other people about an idea, secret, problem etc
share.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: Students were able to share their experiences.
Would you like to share your feelings with the group?
share.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 5: to have the same opinion, quality, or experience as someone else
share.translation[0].note_box[0].section: It was clear that the police did not share her opinion.
He shared my view of what had been going on.
I know that many people do not share my feelings.
The only way to change things is to elect politicians who share our values.
I share the concern of parents about the content of some of these computer games.
This view is now widely shared.
share.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: one of the equal parts into which the ownership  of a company is divided
share.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: We’ve got shares in Allied Chemicals.
share.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: the part of something that you own or are responsible for
share.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: I do my share (=do my part) of the housework.
I gave them my share of the bill and left.
share.translation[1].note_box[0].section: A lot of the employees own shares in the company.
I bought some shares in British Gas five years ago.
This isn’t a good time to sell shares.
They make their money by trading in stocks and shares.
Shares fell sharply on the London Stock Market yesterday.
The company’s share price has continued to go down.
The government tried to encourage wider share ownership.
He was convicted of illegal share dealing.
share.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: one of the parts into which ownership of a company is divided
share.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The company has the right to issue (=make available and sell) shares in two series.
Friendly companies and banks hold (=own) 56% of all  shares in Germany’s listed companies.
Top-ranking officers in the company sold a block of shares (=a large quantity, usually more than 10,000) on Monday when the price was high.
share.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: different classes of a company’s shares. Each class has different characteristics, for example the right to vote at shareholders’ meetings
share.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: You can buy Class A shares of each of the Funds at the offering price.
Class B shares typically do not charge a frontend sales charge.
share.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: the part of something that belongs to a particular person, organization etc
share.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: Corporations are being encouraged to give a share of their profits to social programs.
share.translation[2].definitions[3].defi: market share that is measured by SALES REVENUE (=money obtained from sales)
share.translation[2].definitions[3].exam: Small electrical appliances took a 28% market share by value with sales reaching 19 billion euros.
share.translation[2].definitions[4].defi: market share that is measured by the number of products sold
share.translation[2].definitions[4].exam: The firm leads the industry with 35% market share by volume in memory and microprocessor cards.
share.translation[2].definitions[5].defi: to increase market share by charging low prices, even if they are not profitable
share.translation[2].definitions[5].exam: People have been competing with silly prices just to buy market share.
